CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 29, 1960, pg. 2, reads: "Syria Mosque was Packed - Courier staff photographer Teenie Harris was stationed behind the speakers' platform on Monday night to get the above view of the two crowded balconies and a partial view of the first-floor guests at Syria Mosque. The auditorium seated 3,750, and 2,000 were accommodated in basement, while an estimated 500 waited outside the Mosque.  The capacity crowd, similar to the one which greeted Senator Kennedy recently, heard Vice President Richard M. Nixon, Republican candidate for President, charge his Democratic opponent with irresponsibility and said the Kennedy camp was exploiting religion to aid the campaign of Senator John F. Kennedy."
TitMainTitle: Vice President Richard M. Nixon on stage gesturing to Pat Nixon, in crowded Syria Mosque, for 1960 presidential campaign
